answers.answer: I have to ask why are you posting on the diabetes forum not liver disease? Elevated AST & ALT means her liver is inflamed. Things you can ask her Gastro are:1. Has an ultrasound been ordered?2. What about a Contrasted CT Scan and/or MRI to look for liver tumors?3. A liver biopsy to see if cirrhosis is present?4. Testing for Hepatitis CThe above will provide an insight as to why her liver's inflamed, that is if moderate to large amounts of alcohol is not part of her lifestyle.

Elevated ast & alt, could also point towards Hep C and/or Liver Cancer. Being a Hep C survivor, I strongly suggest you get a referral to a GI in infectious disease Dr. Primary care Dr. can order test for Hep A, B & C, Cancer Markers and ultra sounds on the liver, which will also cover the spleen and gall bladder. Don't wait to request these tests.

question: My mother's AST (SGOT) on 02/25/2011 was 105 and on 03/03/2011 it was 120.  Her ALT on 02/25/2011 was 122 and on 03/03/2011 was 158.  I am very concerned about her health, but I do not know how this affects her and for how long her liver can withstand these extremely high levels.  Please advise!
title: HELP NEEDED...extremely high liver function test results
